title: useCallback Interview Tree
summary: This interview tree maps how technical conversations about useCallback typically flow. Each branch represents a natural follow-up based on the candidate's response depth and accuracy.
root: What is useCallback and when would you use it?

branches.q: What is useCallback and when would you use it?
branches.intent: Basic understanding check - do they know memoization concept?
branches.signal: Mentions function memoization, referential equality, performance context

branches.intent: Deep performance understanding - do they know the overhead?
branches.signal: Mentions closure overhead, unnecessary memoization, dependency checking cost

branches.q: How does useCallback affect garbage collection?
branches.signal: Discusses closure retention, memory leaks, reference holding

branches.q: What happens if you omit the dependency array?
branches.intent: Understanding React hooks rules and stale closures
branches.signal: Explains stale closures, ESLint exhaustive-deps rule, infinite loops

branches.q: Debug this: useCallback returns stale values
branches.signal: Identifies missing dependencies, suggests fixes, explains closure scope

branches.q: When would you choose useCallback over useMemo?
branches.intent: Hook selection reasoning and understanding differences
branches.signal: Functions vs values, referential equality needs, child component optimization

branches.q: Show me a real scenario where useCallback is essential
branches.signal: Child component props, event handlers, effect dependencies, real examples

branches.q: Optimize this component with 100+ child components
branches.signal: React.memo combination, prop drilling solutions, context optimization

branches.intent: Experience with gotchas and code quality awareness
branches.signal: Over-optimization, inline objects in deps, unnecessary memoization patterns

branches.intent: Code quality assessment and refactoring skills
branches.signal: Identifies problems, suggests improvements, explains reasoning

branches.q: How would you test components using useCallback?
branches.intent: Testing strategy and quality assurance mindset
branches.signal: Behavior testing vs implementation testing, mocking strategies
